flawed_nl_solution:
First find how many months the loans last: 20 years * 12 months/year = <<20*12=240>>240 months
Then divide the cost of the house by the number of payments to find the monthly payment before interest: $480000 / 240 months = $<<480000/240=2000>>2000/month
Then do the same thing to find the monthly payment before interest on the trailer: $120000 / 240 months = $<<120000/240=50>>50/month
Then subtract the cost of the trailer payment from the cost of the house payment to find the difference: $2000/month - $50/month = $<<2000-50=1950>>1950/month
#### 1950

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 500, not 50. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
